channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Pete Hegseth’s ‘Kill Everybody’ Command
item.description: The secretary of war’s alleged order that led to drug boat–strike survivors’ being killed appears to be a violation of the norms of warfare.

item.title: Trump makes case for tariffs
item.description: Trump on Saturday once again made his plea for the Supreme Court to rule in favor of his sweeping tariffs.

item.title: Military Lawfare Is a Red Line
item.description: Incorporating the Pentagon into the campaign against political enemies — even those who make a craven video — raises the abuse of executive power to a...

item.title: Ukrainian delegation en route to Washington after previous negotiator resigns
item.description: Ukrainian officials led by Security Council Secretary Rustem Umerov are on their way to Washington on Saturday ahead of negotiations the next day, Ukr...

item.title: Even the Pope couldn’t avoid the Airbus software fix that disrupted flights across the world
item.description: An analysis found computer code that may have contributed to a sudden drop in the altitude of a JetBlue plane last month.

item.title: Watchdog group hits Letitia James with bar complaint after federal judge tosses case
item.description: A conservative-aligned watchdog group has filed a bar complaint urging an investigation into New York Attorney General Letitia James.

item.title: Value of State Department press briefings in question as Trump trims them
item.description: The State Department has not held a public press briefing in over three months, even as Washington's rivals intensify their communication campaigns to...

item.title: Inside NORAD’s holiday command: How the same team that tracks Santa guards North America
item.description: NORAD's Santa tracker uses military radar and satellites protecting North America to follow Santa's Christmas Eve journey in a nearly 70-year traditio...

item.title: Brown grass caused the PGA Tour to pull out of a historic Maui golf course, leaving a $50 million hole for the island reeling from drought, wildfires
item.description: West Maui is facing drought and still reeling from its 2023 wildfire.

item.title: White House launches media bias tracker
item.description: The White House has launched a new section on its website dedicated to calling out media it considers misleading or having a bias in its coverage of P...

item.title: Santa is coming to Wall Street early this season, and analysts say 2026 is shaping up to be another big year of gains
item.description: Deutsche Bank predicted the S&P 500 will finish next year at 8,000, representing a 17% jump from Friday's close.

item.title: Gavin Newsom’s Achilles’ Heel
item.description: The governor is one of the top 2028 Democratic contenders, but Scott Wiener’s radical record leaves Newsom vulnerable to attack.

item.title: How Europe Fell Behind
item.description: Brussels regulated first and asked questions never, among other reasons.

item.title: Despite their ‘no limits’ friendship, Russia is paying a nearly 90% markup on sanctioned goods from China — compared to 9% from other countries
item.description: While the value of Chinese ball-bearing exports to Russia jumped by 76% from 2021 to 2024, the quantity of exports actually dropped by 13%.

item.title: Hegseth defends lethal strikes against alleged drug traffickers: 'Biden coddled terrorists, we kill them'
item.description: Secretary of War Pete Hegseth defends Trump administration strikes on Caribbean drug vessels, stating that, "Biden coddled terrorists, we kill them."'

item.title: Abbey Gate Gold Star father blisters Biden after Afghan national allegedly ambushes 2 National Guardsmen in DC
item.description: Gold Star father blames Biden administration for D.C. shooting by Afghan national, citing inadequate vetting during failed 2021 Afghanistan withdrawal...

item.title: Texas GOP Rep. Troy Nehls says he's not running again
item.description: Rep. Troy Nehls on Saturday joined the growing list of lawmakers who have announced their impending retirement from Congress.

item.title: Northwestern will pay Trump admin $75 million to settle antisemitism cases and restore funding while agreeing to ‘socialize international students’
item.description: The Trump administration had frozen $790 million in grants that contributed to university layoffs and the resignation of the university's president in...

item.title: USCIS halts 'all asylum decisions' after DC shooting of National Guard members
item.description: USCIS halted all asylum decisions after an Afghan national was accused of shooting National Guard members in Washington, D.C., killing one of them.

item.title: These Do-Ahead Meals Are The Easiest Three-Course Dinner Parties You’ll Ever Host
item.description: These make-ahead, hard-to-mess-up combinations involve just enough effort to turn a weeknight gathering into a memorable meal.

item.title: 80 Years After Nuremberg Condemned Nazi Research, Doctors Are Still Committing Atrocities
item.description: Perpetuating false definitions of the earliest stages of life mirrors the dehumanization that enabled Nazi experiments on the 'subhuman.'

item.title: The National Guard Shooting Tragedy
item.description: Another gut-wrenching day for the country.

item.description: For the frustrated and disillusioned on the right, here are four foundational reasons to give thanks for this great country.
